snippet: The success of “The Hunger Games: Catching Fire” and “Frozen” should put to rest the assumption that audiences don’t want to see female-centric action stories.
abstract: Editorial contends the success of movies The Hunger Games: Catching Fire and Frozen should put to rest the assumption that audiences do not want to see female-centric movies; notes that assumption is often trotted out to defend the gender imbalance on the screen; maintains there is no market-based excuse for the dearth of female leads.
lead_paragraph: The success of “The Hunger Games: Catching Fire” and “Frozen” should put to rest the assumption that audiences don’t want to see female-centric action stories.
